answerText: Hunger [or Sult][10] Hunger is a novel by this Norwegian author and Nobel Laureate who also wrote The Growth of the Soil.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 12 | 17 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: At the end of this novel, the protagonist joins a ship's captain on a voyage to get coal for Cadiz; in this novel, he had earlier pretended to be the journalist Andreas Tangen. [10] Name this novel in which the unnamed protagonist treasures the pencil he used to write his dissertation on "Philosophical Cognition," which is one of his only belongings.
